messages.messageBody:
Hey when you finish the book or whatever it is if there is an online
download I would love to read it.

Brooke

On 11/21/05, Ren Allen <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>
> "To whom is the article going? It sounds like a good read :)"
>
> Why I just don't know yet.. It was one of those things that swirl
> around in your brain and need to get out.:)
>
> The trouble is, I'm stuck on chocolate...I may never get back to the
> whole unschooling connection. Having too much fun with the portal to
> write about the learning stuff. Sigh.
>
> Ren
>

messages.subject: Re: article; was intro Anastasia
messages.msgSnippet: ... enough to be ... Guess what I found this last shopping trip? Hershey s Special Dark *CHIPS* for baking! ... LOL last night we were having ice cream and
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Daniel MacIntyre
<daniel.macintyre@g...> wrote:
>
> There are worse things to be stuck on than chocolate
>
> My personal favorite is dark chocolate - especially the semi-sweet
>morsels
> you bake into cookies. I have a real problem keeping them long
enough to be
> baked. My Grandmother used to keep two bags - one up high in the
>pantry and
> one in the door of the refrigerator that was unofficially
>specifically for
> snacking on. The taste still brings back memories :)

Guess what I found this last shopping trip? Hershey's Special Dark
*CHIPS* for baking!

> On 11/21/05, Ren Allen <starsuncloud@c...> wrote:
> >
> > The trouble is, I'm stuck on chocolate
> > Ren

LOL last night we were having ice cream and NesQuik syrup. I
squeezed a bit directly into my mouth and DS (7) said "You're
obsessed with chocolate!" at which point DH and I started laughing
and I said "Yes I am." But then they already knew that since I'm
known to put chocolate chips on my Cheerios...and other cereals (the
fruity nutty types are especially good with chocolate chips) and
sherbet (DH thought I was nuts until we found that Edy's makes
orange sherbet with chocolate chips already in it!)

--Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] article; was intro Anastasia
messages.msgSnippet: There are worse things to be stuck on than chocolate My personal favorite is dark chocolate - especially the semi-sweet morsels you bake into cookies. I have a
messages.messageBody:
There are worse things to be stuck on than chocolate

My personal favorite is dark chocolate - especially the semi-sweet morsels
you bake into cookies. I have a real problem keeping them long enough to be
baked. My Grandmother used to keep two bags - one up high in the pantry and
one in the door of the refrigerator that was unofficially specifically for
snacking on. The taste still brings back memories :)

messages.subject: article; was intro Anastasia
messages.msgSnippet: To whom is the article going? It sounds like a good read :) Why I just don t know yet.. It was one of those things that swirl around in your brain and need
messages.messageBody:
"To whom is the article going? It sounds like a good read :)"

Why I just don't know yet.. It was one of those things that swirl
around in your brain and need to get out.:)

The trouble is, I'm stuck on chocolate...I may never get back to the
whole unschooling connection. Having too much fun with the portal to
write about the learning stuff. Sigh.

Ren
